title: Howlin' Wolf  Message To The Young(blues)(mp3@320)[rogercc]
description:
Howlin Wolf  Message to the Young
Label: Chess, 
Released March 16 1971 
Format:Mp3@320

Funky blues work from Howlin Wolf ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ his key entry into the funked-up genre that Chess Records was cutting at the end of the 60s with other blues artists like Etta James, Bo Diddley, and Muddy Waters! As on records with those artists, Wolf's older modes are updated here for a hipper, younger audience ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ backed up with a bouncing batch of electrified backings arranged by Sonny Thompson, and conducted by Thompson and Cash McCall, the latter of whom is most likely playing a bit of guitar here. Tracks are a bit longer than usual, and filled with plenty of heavy guitar bits next to the vocals ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ and titles include "I Smell A Rat", "Miss James", "If I Were A Bird", "She's Lookin Good", "Turn Me On", and "Message To The Young".
